user.biography:
The official Instagram account of Polaris Snowmobiles, a leader in the snowmobile industry since 1954. 
Check out our 2022 lineup ⬇️  #LetsRide

node.text:
The most powerful production 2-stroke turbo* - the all-new 𝗣𝗮𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘁 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝘀𝘁. 10% More power at sea level, and 50% more power at 10,000 feet over the 850 Patriot. Where will the Patriot Boost take you?

SnowCheck exclusive with limited quantities - see your dealer for details. See link in bio to learn more.

*Based on internal Polaris testing.

node.text: At Polaris, racing is a part of our DNA. We are testing, developing, and innovating every weekend at the racetrack. The race season kicks off this weekend for @snocross and @corpowersports - and Team Polaris is ready.

node.text:
As we wrap up our safety tips this week, remember, motorsports safety goes beyond the ride, Properly storing and maintaining your sled during the off season will help keep it in great condition for when you’re ready to ride as the next snow falls.

What are your best safety tips for snowmobiling? Share with us in the comments below!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Polaris Snowmobiles on August 06, 2021 tagging @sledneckdan. May be an image of 1 person and indoor.

node.text:
We caught up with Polaris Athlete, Dan Adams (@sledneckdan) to learn his best tips on prepping for avalanche safety.

Motorsports Safety Tip #2: Be a Pack Prepared Rider. Bringing the right thing to help when things don’t go as planned is key. Ride prepared with winter survival and first aid kits, as well as tools, an extra belt, and a tow rope. Your owner’s manual is a great resource for a full list of recommended gear to pack.

Check out the link in our bio for the full Q&A with Dan Adams on his safety tips

node.text:
Polaris is passionate about helping people experience the outdoors. No matter the ride, the highest priority should always be safety. August is Motorsports Awareness Month, so we’re kicking things off this week with a look at safety best practices while in the snow.

Throughout the week, we’re highlighting a few of our top safety tips.

Today, we’re starting with what happens before the ride: No matter how seasoned of a rider you are, always thoroughly assess your sled before each ride. Pre-ride inspections can reveal malfunctioning or damaged vehicles. Refer to the owner’s manual for a full pre-ride checklist to conduct before every ride. Check out the link in our bio for an article on more safety tips!
